<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">No. of Shares:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Per Share Exercise Price: $</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><I>February &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2010, the date when you received written notification of all the terms of this grant, is the offer date (&#147;Offer Date&#148;) for this stock option grant. You have sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the
Offer Date to accept this stock option grant by signing and returning the enclosed &#147;Acceptance&#148; Form to Cytec Industries Inc., Compensation Department, U.S. Corporate Headquarters in Garret Mt. If you do not expressly accept this stock
option grant within sixty (60)&nbsp;days of the Offer Date (by April &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2010), the grant will be deemed &#147;non-qualifying&#148; under Belgian tax law and the stock options will be taxable on the capital gain at normal
Belgian tax rates at the time of exercise. For Belgian tax purposes only, the option will be deemed to be granted on the 60<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day following the Offer Date if you have returned the signed Acceptance Form within 60 days of the Offer Date.
</FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Dear Fellow Employee: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">As a key employee of Cytec Industries Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), or of a subsidiary or affiliate of the Company, you have been granted by the Compensation and Management Development Committee (the &#147;Committee&#148;) of the
Company&#146;s Board of Directors a non-qualified stock option to purchase not more than the aggregate number of shares of Common Stock of the Company, par value $.01 per share (&#147;Common Stock&#148;) set forth above at the per share exercise
price set forth above, all subject to the terms and conditions hereof and of the Company&#146;s 1993 Stock Award and Incentive Plan, as amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;). A copy of the Plan, under which this option is granted to you, will be made
available to you on request by contacting the undersigned. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The date of grant of this option is the date of this letter, which
is the date on which the Committee voted to grant this option, although you have sixty (60)&nbsp;days from the Offer Date to expressly accept the option. The per share exercise price set forth above is equal to the closing market price of Cytec
common stock on the NYSE on the date of grant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon receipt by the Company of notification of exercise of option in the form prescribed from
time to time by the Committee, and upon receipt of the exercise price per share multiplied by the number of shares being purchased pursuant to such exercise, the Company will cause a certificate or certificates for such shares then purchased to be
delivered to the person entitled thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Certain restrictions with respect to the option include, but are not limited to, the following:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) This option must be exercised if at all and to the extent exercised, no later than ten years from the date of grant, and then only
(except as provided in paragraphs (5)&nbsp;and (6)&nbsp;below) if you are then an employee of the Company or of a company which on the date of exercise is a subsidiary or affiliate (as defined in the Company&#146;s 1993 Stock Award and Incentive
Plan, as amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;)) of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) This option shall vest and be exercisable in cumulative installments over a period of three years as
follows: to the extent of not more than one-third of the number of shares subject hereto, at any time after the expiration of the first year of the term hereof; to the extent of not more than an additional one-third of such shares, at any time after
the expiration of the second year of such term; and to the extent of the remainder of such shares, at any time after the expiration of the third year of such term; provided that, as specified in Section&nbsp;7 of the Plan, this grant shall be
immediately exercisable in full upon a Change of Control (as defined in the Plan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) This option is not transferable otherwise than by will
or by the laws of descent and distribution or, if then permitted under Rule 16b-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, pursuant to a qualified domestic relations order as defined under the Internal Revenue Code and it may be exercised during
your lifetime, only by you or your guardian or legal representative; provided however, upon any transfer, this option shall be exercisable by the transferee only to the extent that it would be exercisable by you if it had not been transferred.
Notwithstanding the prior sentence, you may transfer this option, in whole or in part, to (i)&nbsp;your spouse, (ii)&nbsp;your child or children, (iii)&nbsp;your grandchild or grandchildren or (iv)&nbsp;a trust for any of the foregoing; provided
that the transfer shall be subject to all of the terms of the Plan and this grant letter and, in addition, (A)&nbsp;the transferred option may not be retransferred except to you, (B)&nbsp;you remain liable for all withholding taxes payable on
account of this option, (C)&nbsp;the Company may place transfer restrictions against any shares of Common Stock issued to a transferee upon exercise of this option in order to assure compliance with the Securities Act of 1933, as amended,
(D)&nbsp;you give prompt written notice of the transfer to the Secretary of the Committee including name, address, tax I.D. number and date of birth of the transferee, number of shares subject to the transfer, and such other information as the
Company may require and (E)&nbsp;this option shall be exercisable by the transferee only to the extent that it would be exercisable by you if it had not been so transferred. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4) In the event of termination of your employment, this option, to the extent not theretofore exercised, shall forthwith terminate unless such termination of employment shall be by reason of a cause
described in paragraph (5)&nbsp;or (6)&nbsp;below, in which case the provisions of paragraph (5)&nbsp;or (6)&nbsp;below, as the case may be, shall be applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5) In the event that your employment with the Company or a subsidiary or affiliate of the Company terminates by reason of your (i)&nbsp;death, (ii)&nbsp;disability or (iii)&nbsp;retirement on or after
your 55th birthday with ten or more continuous years of service or if not continuous, then ten or more years of combined service as determined in the discretion of the Company&#146;s Vice President of Human Resources, and the date of termination is
eight months or more after the date of grant of this option, subject to paragraph (7). this option may be exercised by you, your estate, any transferee under paragraph 3 above, or any person who acquires the right to exercise this grant by reason of
your death, until one year after the last date on which any options or SARs granted to you by the Company, which are not subsequently cancelled, become fully exercisable (subject to installment exercise provisions of paragraph 2, above), but not
after ten years from the date of grant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6) In the event that the Company or a subsidiary or affiliate of the Company terminates your
employment (except for dishonesty or other good cause, in which case this grant expires), subject to paragraph (7), you may exercise this option at any time within one year after any such termination, but not after ten years from the date of grant,
to the extent of the number of shares which were exercisable by you at the date of such termination of your employment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(7) In the event that
you compete, or you commence employment with or otherwise provide service to any person or entity which competes, with the Company or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates anywhere in the world in the research and development, manufacture,
distribution or sale of any specialty chemicals or materials as determined by the Board of Directors in its sole discretion, unless approved in writing by the then Chief Executive Officer of the Company, this option, to the extent not theretofore
exercised, shall forthwith terminate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(8) The Company, with the approval of an officer, may, at any time and without cause, suspend the
exercisability of this option if it becomes aware of information that indicates that there may be grounds to
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
terminate your employment for dishonesty or other good cause. If upon conclusion of the investigation the Company determines that it has not discovered grounds to terminate your employment for
dishonesty or other good cause, the suspension shall be terminated. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(9) Nothing in this grant shall confer on you any right to continue in
the employ of the Company or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates or interfere in any way with the right of the Company or any subsidiary or affiliate to terminate your employment at any time. The Plan is discretionary in nature and any Awards made
under the Plan are voluntary and occasional. No participant has any claim to be granted any Award or other benefits in lieu of any Award. Subject to applicable law, this Award and any payments in respect of this Award shall not be taken into account
for purposes of determining any benefits under any benefit plan of the Company or any of its subsidiaries, or for any notice payment or payment in lieu of notice. The Company shall have no obligation to make any future grants of Awards under the
Plan or otherwise to make any future Awards under the Plan as part of any participant&#146;s annual compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(10) Subject to such
limitations, if any, as the Committee may establish, you may satisfy your mandatory federal and state income tax withholding obligations resulting from the exercise of this option by requesting the Company to withhold shares of Common Stock having a
fair market value equal to the withholding obligations. In order to prevent fractional shares, the number of shares withheld shall be rounded up to the nearest whole share, with the value of the fraction, being retained as additional optional
withholding. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(11) Your exercise of this option, in whole or in part, constitutes your agreement (i)&nbsp;to pay the Company promptly, on
demand, any withholding taxes due in respect of the exercise of this grant, (ii)&nbsp;that the Company, its subsidiaries and affiliates may deduct an amount equal to such withholding taxes from any amounts owing to you by the Company and/or any of
such subsidiaries or affiliates, (iii)&nbsp;that the Company may withhold from you shares of Common Stock until the withholding taxes have been paid and (iv)&nbsp;to return immediately to the Company at its request any amounts which the Board of
Directors has directed the Company to recover from you in accordance with the terms of the Executive Claw Back policy as in effect on the date of this option and (v)&nbsp;to return immediately to the Company at its request any Gains you realize on
exercise of this option during the period commencing six months prior to termination of your employment and ending two years after your termination of employment if during such time period: (x)&nbsp;you disclose any Confidential Information to a
third party outside the scope of your employment or (y)&nbsp;you compete, or you commence employment with or otherwise provide service to any person or entity which competes, with the Company or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates anywhere in the
world in the research and development, manufacture, distribution or sale of any specialty chemicals or materials as determined by the Board of Directors in its sole discretion, unless approved in writing by the then Chief Executive Officer of the
Company. For purposes of this paragraph: &#147;Gains&#148; means the difference between the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date(s) you exercise any portion of this option and the exercise price, multiplied by the number
of options exercised, without regard to any tax liabilities arising from such exercise; and &#147;Confidential Information&#148; means any information which is, or is designed to be, used in the business of the Company or any of its subsidiaries or
affiliates or results from its or their research and/or development activities, (ii)&nbsp;is private or confidential in that it is not generally known or available to the public and (iii)&nbsp;gives the Company or any of its subsidiaries or
affiliates an opportunity to obtain an advantage over competitors who do not know or use it. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company reserves the right to require this
option to be exercised only within the United States and to require stock certificates issuable to you upon such exercise to be delivered only within the United States to you or to such person who is appropriately authorized by you. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Prior to the earliest time that this option may be exercised by you, the Company will deliver to you a prospectus which meets the requirements of the
Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and which further describes the Plan and options granted thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event is the grant of this
option to you to be deemed, directly or indirectly, a recommendation by the Company that you at any time exercise this option. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This grant and all determinations made and actions taken pursuant hereto shall be governed by the laws of
the State of Delaware without giving effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. You and the Company agree that any and all disputes arising under this grant are to be resolved exclusively by courts sitting in Delaware. You and the Company
irrevocably consent to the jurisdiction of such courts and agree not to assert by way of motion, as a defense, or otherwise, any claim that either you or the Company is not subject personally to the jurisdiction of such court, that the action, suit
or proceeding is brought in an inconvenient forum, that the venue of the action, suit or proceeding is improper, or that this grant and its terms may not be enforced in or by such court. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This grant and the exercise of this option are subject to the terms and conditions hereof and of the Plan. A copy of the Plan, under which this option is granted to you, will be made available to you on
request by contacting the undersigned. In the event of any conflict between the terms of this option and the provisions of the Plan, the provisions of the Plan shall govern. </FONT></P> <P

<DESCRIPTION>FORM OF 2010 EXECUTIVE CLAW BACK ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Form of 2010 Executive Claw Back Acknowledgement</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2">Exhibit 10.2(d)(xv) </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2">Form of 2010 Executive Claw Back Acknowledgement </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2">I acknowledge receiving a copy of the Executive Claw Back Policy
dated as of January 27, 2010. I also acknowledge receiving a target ICP award for the 2010 calendar year (normally payable in 2011 based on 2010 performance), a target performance cash award for the 2012 year (normally payable in 2013 based on 2012
performance), a restricted stock unit award dated January 27, 2010 (normally payable in shares of stock in 2013) and a grant of stock options dated January 27, 2010. In consideration of my receiving these awards, I agree that if the Board of
Directors of Cytec Industries Inc. directs Cytec, pursuant to the terms of the Executive Claw Back Policy and/or such awards, to recover from me all or any portion of the gross amount of such awards previously paid to me prior to the time of such
direction, I will immediately return such amount to Cytec. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2">I agree that the exercise of Cytec&#146;s claw back rights shall be governed by the laws of
the State of Delaware without giving effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. I agree that any and all disputes arising relating to Cytec&#146;s exercise of its claw back rights are to be resolved exclusively by courts sitting in Delaware.
I irrevocably consent to the jurisdiction of such courts and agree not to assert by way of motion, as a defense, or otherwise, any claim that either I or the Company is not subject personally to the jurisdiction of such court, that the action, suit
or proceeding is brought in an inconvenient forum, that the venue of the action, suit or proceeding is improper, or that the Executive Claw Back Policy or this acknowledgement may not be enforced in or by such court. </FONT></P> <P

<DESCRIPTION>EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Employment Agreement</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Exhibit 10.2(w) </FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px">

<IMG SRC="g40199g34s41.jpg" ALT="LOGO"> </P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>FREE TRANSLATION </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Between: </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The <I>Soci&eacute;t&eacute; Anonyme </I>CYTEC &#150; Square Marie Curie 11
&#150; B 1070 BRUSSELS, represented here by the undersigned, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Hereinafter referred to as &#147;CYTEC&#148;, </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>and </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;ARANZANA Frank </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Residing at 1650 Beersel, Bloemendal 29 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">hereinafter referred to as &#147;the employee&#148;, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">It has been agreed as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 1 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CYTEC hires the employee as
President Cytec Speciality Chemicals, who accepts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee will perform his services at CYTEC or at other companies of its group.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CYTEC reserves the right to assign the employee to any positions which are compatible with his knowledge and skills, both in Belgium and
abroad. For the application of this clause, account will be taken of the economic interest of the company and of the personal interest of the employee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the necessities of the service so require, the employee accepts that CYTEC may oblige him to reside near his place of work. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee accepts to travel for the needs of the service by any means of transportation which will be indicated to him, including private means of transportation. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 2 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The contract
is concluded for an unlimited duration and will begin retroactively on July&nbsp;1</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">st</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">, 2008. The present contract cancels and replaces the labour agreement of June15, 1999 and his enclosures. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 3 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee shall be allocated a monthly gross amount of &#128; 23.347,70. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee
renounces to the automatic salary increase linked to the consumer price index as long as he is exercising the function of President Cytec Speciality Chemicals </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The compensations are paid into the bank account indicated by the employee, under deduction of the legal withholdings and contributions for the group insurance program which the employee is obliged to
join. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 4 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each party
has the right to terminate the present employment contract in accordance with the provisions of the Employment Contracts Act of July&nbsp;3, 1978. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><U>Article 5 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee acknowledges that all the results generally whatsoever of the works, studies, research or tests which
he or she will perform in the exercise of his or her functions, and notably the inventions, methods of production, procedures and improvements which he or she shall develop will be the exclusive property of the Company where he or she performs his
or her services. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Cytec alone will have the right to dispose of them, profit from them and, if appropriate, have them patented, without the
employee being able to claim any indemnity or special compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 6 </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee undertakes not to reveal, publish or make known directly or indirectly the production and business secrets of which he or she shall have
knowledge. Notably covered here are: the procedures, tricks of the trade, plans, projects, agreements, technical, commercial, accounting and other types of information. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">He or she shall also refrain from engaging in or co-operating with any act of unfair competition. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">The above obligations will not cease with this contract, and the employee will remain bound by them whatever the cause of his departure. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 7 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee undertakes, in the event of termination of this contract after the trial period, by CYTEC for serious reason or by the employee, unless the latter cannot demonstrate a serious reason
imputable to CYTEC, and under reservation of the respect of articles 65 and 86 of the Law of 3&nbsp;July 1978 on employment contracts, not to compete with CYTEC or the companies of its group, either by acting for his or her own account, directly or
indirectly, or by entering into the service of another employer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">However, this obligation relates only to activities similar to those which
the employee shall have exercised at CYTEC or at companies of its group during the twelve months preceding his or her departure; it does not extend beyond the territory of Belgium, and it is limited to a period of twelve months as of the day that
the employment contract comes to an end. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In exchange for this undertaking, CYTEC will pay to the employee a lump-sum indemnity equal to 12
months of compensation, except CYTEC exercises its option to waive the application of this non-competition clause within a period of 15 days as of the cessation of the contract. This article does not apply if the employee is a sales representative
at the time of his or her departure. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 8 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee hereby acknowledges having received a copy of and having taken knowledge of the Work Rules, which constitute an annex to the present employment contract. Furthermore, the employee hereby
formally accepts the terms and conditions thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Article 9 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Special conditions (provided they do not contradict legal and statutory provisions): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee will benefit from the tax status of &#147;non-resident tax payer&#148;. The calculation of taxable earnings takes into consideration the current amount of
non-taxable earnings (max. &#128;11.250) for &#147;management&#148; positions. The employer guarantees &#147;30% travel exclusion&#148;, resulting in a reduction of taxable earnings equivalent to a 30% of the annual working days spent outside
Belgium. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee will benefit 100% from applicable tax reductions following events and
private investments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The employee will benefit from assistance with their declaration of earnings to Belgian tax authorities as long as he possesses the status of &#147;non-resident tax
payer&#148;. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Employee will benefit: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">from a thirteenth month, in accordance with Belgian&nbsp;legislation; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">from a holiday bonus, in accordance with Belgian legislation; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(if the conditions of the award are satisfied) from an annual bonus, in accordance with current CYTEC regulations for the category &#147;Officers&#148;, with a target
of 50% of annual salary. Half the bonus will be paid in company insurance with the AXA policy number 212.785.898; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with Cytec&#146;s Company car policy, the employee will benefit from a company car. The budget is defined in the policy in agreement with the position in
the Company. The Employee will pay the employer a monthly sum equal to 27% of the taxable benefit; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">from a fuel card whose usage is limited to the company car; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As per Company policy from a monthly all-in allowance of &#128;285 (category 2 amount with company car), covering certain expenses which are not reimbursed by expense
notes; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Edition &#150; 02/2008 </B></FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Foreword </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Cytec Surface Specialties Supplemental Pension Plan is a group insurance plan in addition to the regular Cytec Group Insurance Plan. It is intended to provide employees with a Belgian employment
agreement, who are subject to Belgian social security contributions and graded G20 and higher, with a comfortable standard of living when they retire. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In this handbook you will find the necessary information about this supplemental pension plan. Note that this new supplemental plan will be in force as from 1&nbsp;March 2008 onwards and replaces any
existing AXA supplemental plans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We are sure this supplemental plan will contribute to your satisfaction as an employee of
Cytec. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Table of contents </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>USER&#146;S HANDBOOK &#150; AXA&#146;S SUPPLEMENTAL PENSION PLAN FOR EMPLOYEES OF GRADE 20 OR MORE</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Why does Cytec offer you a supplemental pension plan?</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>How can I position &#147;employee benefits&#148; in my own financial plan?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We all know that only few financial instruments allow an employer to deliver income to its employees on a tax efficient basis. One of those vehicles is a supplemental group
insurance which defers current employment income, taxable at marginal income rates and subject to full employee and employer social security contributions, to retirement income which is taxable at much lower tax rates (currently 16.66%) and subject
to limited social taxes (currently between 3.55% and 5.55% depending on the amount).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Cytec has set up such a group insurance with AXA. This handbook is therefore intended to explain the following benefits in detail:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;additional savings benefits (retirement)</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;additional death in service benefits</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>1</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">



<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>USER&#146;S HANDBOOK &#150; AXA&#146;S SUPPLEMENTAL PENSION PLAN FOR EMPLOYEES OF GRADE 20 OR MORE</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>What are the basic principles of the supplemental pension plan?</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Who is a member?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All employees with a Belgian employment agreement (whether fixed term or open-ended), who are subject to Belgian social security contributions and graded G20 and higher,
automatically become members of this supplemental pension plan. Membership is immediate from the date of hire (if taking a job graded G20 and higher) or at the date of promotion to a job graded G20 and higher.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You continue your participation in this supplemental plan as long as you work for Cytec and are graded G20 or higher. This plan is interrupted in case of suspension of the
employment agreement (for example: termination, career interruption, full-time time credit).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All eligible employees who work part-time will have the same benefits as those working full time, subject to pro ration in accordance with their working time,</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>When does the group insurance end?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Membership to the group insurance will cease as soon as you stop working for Cytec and, more precisely, in the following cases:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- retirement or early retirement</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- dismissal or resignation</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- death</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Membership to this pension plan will also cease in case of demotion to a grade below G20. Note that in this case, no new contributions will be paid into this plan but you will
remain entitled to the already accrued reserves which will continue to earn interest (currently 3.25% plus profit sharing interest) until one of the three above listed situations occurs.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>

insurance company.</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The ICP budget is determined by Cytec&#146;s Executive Leadership Team in accordance with Cytec Industries&#146; Incentive Compensation Plan and relates to the prior
year of performance.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The contribution is calculated and paid once a year, on March&nbsp;1 of every year. The payment to the insurance company occurs within 8 working days.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The contribution can never be lower than &#128;250. In case of an incomplete year, a proportionate minimum amount will be paid (based on the effective number of full
affiliation months).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The contribution can on the other hand not exceed the authorised tax deductible level. Indeed the sum of your legal/state pension and your extra-legal pensions cannot
exceed 80% of your last normal gross salary and this for a full career of 40 years.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AXA grants a guaranteed/fixed interest (of currently 3.25%) as well as a profit sharing interest on these contributions.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">



<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>USER&#146;S HANDBOOK &#150; AXA&#146;S SUPPLEMENTAL PENSION PLAN FOR EMPLOYEES OF GRADE 20 OR MORE</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Who does pay this contribution?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From a tax/legal perspective the contribution is qualified as an employer contribution. On top, the company pays the insurance tax (currently 4.4%) and the social security
charges (currently 8.86%) related to these contributions.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="2"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>What does happen in case of early retirement or leaving Cytec?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In case of early retirement or when leaving Cytec, AXA will determine the amount that has already been accrued at that point in time (= sum of contributions +
interest).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From a tax and legal perspective the same regulations are
applicable as for your regular group insurance plan (i.e. the accrued amount will be reduced with 3.55% up to 5.55% as social security charge and the remaining amount will be taxed at currently 16.66% in case of early retirement or 10.09% if you
continue working up to age 65).</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>What does happen if you chose payment or transfer?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The retirement benefit is payable at age 65. If you retire earlier and ask your retirement benefit, AXA will simply determine the amount that has already been
accrued.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As from the January 1, 2010 the retirement benefit will no
longer be payable before age 60.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AXA makes the necessary social and income tax deductions on the
retirement benefit. On January 1, 2008, those amounted to about 3.55% to 5.55% social security contribution (depending on the level of the capital to be paid) plus 16.66% taxes, increased with communal taxes.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>4</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">



<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>USER&#146;S HANDBOOK &#150; AXA&#146;S SUPPLEMENTAL PENSION PLAN FOR EMPLOYEES OF GRADE 20 OR MORE</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>How is my death benefit defined?</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As mentioned, besides the &#147;retirement&#148; part, your additional group insurance does also include a &#147;death&#148; part.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If you die during the time you are affiliated to this additional savings plan, (following an illness, an accident at work or at home,&#133;), your relatives are entitled to a
death benefit which is defined as follows:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Death benefit = minimum of 1 x S</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The accrued savings amount of your retirement benefit is included in the above benefit. In other words, if you would die, the insurance company would pay the accrued savings
amount of the retirement benefit to your heir with a minimum of 1 time annual base salary.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Where:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">S = gross monthly salary of December (preceding year) x 13.92</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The cost for this death benefit is entirely paid for by the Company.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Who does receive the benefits? In which order?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In case of death, the above benefits will be paid according to the following order:</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. Your wife / husband or legal cohabitant</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. Your children</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. Everyone designed by you in a signed document</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. Your mother and father</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. Your brothers and sisters</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. Every other legal heir(ess)</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. The financial fund</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Cytec allows you to change this order on condition that you specify it in a signed document given to HR.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>5</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">



<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>USER&#146;S HANDBOOK &#150; AXA&#146;S SUPPLEMENTAL PENSION PLAN FOR EMPLOYEES OF GRADE 20 OR MORE</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>What does happen to my retirement benefits when I leave Cytec?</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="6"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>What will happen when I leave Cytec?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">When, for whatever reason, you leave Cytec, your supplemental pension plan stops. At retirement you will be entitled to the retirement benefits which have been built up
while you worked for Cytec and were eligible for this supplemental plan, increased with the accrued return since this date.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="6"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Be careful, the additional death cover stops immediately, which means that you are no longer insured against this risk from that moment on.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="6"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Can I transfer my accrued rights in my new employer&#146;s pension plan or elsewhere?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Whatever the reason for leaving, you are the owner of the retirement capital.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following procedure is legally
defined.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Chronological procedure to be followed by the
employer, AXA and the employee</I></B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="65%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Action to take</B>
</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>By who</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Time limit</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Announce your departure to AXA</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Employer</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>30 days</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Inform employer</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AXA</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>30 days</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Inform employee</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Employer</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Immediately</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Communicate your choice to your former employer</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Employee</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>30 days</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Communicate your decision to AXA</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Employer</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>15 days</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Execute the employee&#146;s decision</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AXA</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>30 days</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="6%"></TD>

<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>What are the possible choices?</I></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Choice&nbsp;1</B><I></I><B></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Keep the accrued amount (*)&nbsp;in the plan</I></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Choice&nbsp;2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Transfer the already accrued amount (*)&nbsp;into the pension plan (pension fund or insurance group) of your new employer</I></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Choice&nbsp;3</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Transfer the already accrued amount (*) into a &#147;caisse commune&#148;</I></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Choice&nbsp;4</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Transfer the already accrued amount (*)&nbsp;into a host structure</I></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A host structure is a group insurance which is isolated from the company group insurance and in which you can transfer your accrued rights when you leave. You can also
use them to finance a death benefit.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Until end 2009 you still have a last option which consists in having the accrued amount deposited in your bank account ( = surrender). Be careful, this option does have negative
consequences as the taxes are high.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(*) If you have worked less than one year at Cytec, the accrued rights consist in the reserves accrued with the personal contributions. If you leave the company with at least one
year seniority in the plan, then the accrued rights consist in the reserves accrued with the personal contributions and the employer contributions.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Here is a flowchart to help you make your choice. According to your personal situation you can identify the most suitable option.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>How do I communicate my choice?</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Once AXA has been informed of your departure, you will be informed by AXA within one month of the different possibilities relative to your accrued pension rights.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You then have one month to communicate your choice to AXA.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">After this deadline, the transfer can still be asked anytime. Surrender is still possible until end 2009.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2008 includes a $385.0 before tax non-cash goodwill impairment charge ($358.3 after tax). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to achieve a one-to-one ratio of earnings to fixed charges for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, earnings would need to increase by $10.6 and
$151.1, respectively. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interest on unrecognized tax benefits are not included as they are recognized as part of income tax expense. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-23
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>dex23.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CONSENT OF KPMG LLP
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Consent of KPMG LLP</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">EXHIBIT 23 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Consent of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Cytec Industries Inc.: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We consent to the
incorporation by reference in the registration statements (Nos. 33-80710, 33-83576, 33-85666, 333-62287, 333-11121, 333-45577, 333-107221, 333-122195, 333-151634 and 333-151635) on Form S-8 and in the registration statements (No. 333-127507 and
333-160325) on Form S-3 of Cytec Industries Inc. of our reports dated February&nbsp;24, 2010, with respect to the consolidated balance sheets of Cytec Industries Inc. and subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, and the related
consolidated statements of income, stockholders&#146; equity and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, and the related financial statement schedule, and the effectiveness of internal control over
financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, which reports appear in the December&nbsp;31, 2009 annual report on Form 10-K of Cytec Industries Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our report on the consolidated financial statements refers to a change in the method of accounting for fair value measurements for non-financial assets and non-financial liabilities in 2009, a change in
the methods of accounting for the measurement date of pension and other postretirement plan benefits and for fair value measurements for financial assets and financial liabilities in 2008, and a change in the method of accounting for uncertainty in
income taxes in 2007. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">/s/ KPMG LLP </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Short Hills, New Jersey </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">February&nbsp;24, 2010 </FONT></P>
</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>

<DESCRIPTION>POWERS OF ATTORNEY

<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Powers of Attorney</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 24a </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">POWER OF ATTORNEY </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned
director of Cytec Industries Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#147;Cytec&#148;), does hereby make, constitute and appoint S. Fleming, D.M. Drillock and R. Smith, the address of each of which is in care of Cytec, 5 Garret Mountain Plaza, Woodland Park,
New Jersey 07424, and each of them, the true and lawful attorney for the undersigned, with full power of substitution and revocation to each for the undersigned, and in the name, place and stead of the undersigned, to sign and to file or cause to be
filed, an annual report on Form 10-K with the Securities and Exchange Commission, pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and any and all amendments to such Form 10-K, hereby giving to each of such attorneys full power to do
everything whatsoever required or necessary to be accomplished in and about the premises as fully as the undersigned could do if personally present, hereby ratifying and confirming all that such attorney or substitutes or any of them shall lawfully
do or cause to be done by virtue thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has set her hand as of this 16</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of February, 2010. </FONT></P> <P

do or cause to be done by virtue thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has set his hand as of this 17</FONT><FONT

STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">POWER OF ATTORNEY </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned
director of Cytec Industries Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#147;Cytec&#148;), does hereby make, constitute and appoint S. Fleming, D.M. Drillock and R. Smith, the address of each of which is in care of Cytec, 5 Garret Mountain Plaza, Woodland Park,
New Jersey 07424, and each of them, the true and lawful attorney for the undersigned, with full power of substitution and revocation to each for the undersigned, and in the name, place and stead of the undersigned, to sign and to file or cause to be
filed, an annual report on Form 10-K with the Securities and Exchange Commission, pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and any and all amendments to such Form 10-K, hereby giving to each of such attorneys full power to do
everything whatsoever required or necessary to be accomplished in and about the premises as fully as the undersigned could do if personally present, hereby ratifying and confirming all that such attorney or substitutes or any of them shall lawfully
do or cause to be done by virtue thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has set his hand as of this 17</FONT><FONT

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<FILENAME>dex321.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF CEO PURSUANT TO SECTION 906
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Certification of CEO pursuant to Section 906</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">EXHIBIT 32.1 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CERTIFICATIONS PURSUANT TO </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with the Annual Report of Cytec Industries Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) on Form10-K for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 as filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, Shane Fleming, Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to
Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Report fully complies with the requirements of section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
